command: [Net.ServicePointManager]::SecurityProtocol = [Net.SecurityProtocolType]::Tls12; $ErrorActionPreference='Stop'; $account='admin@example.com'; $out='C:\ProgramData\recon\hibp_admin_example.com.json'; New-Item -ItemType Directory -Force -Path C:\ProgramData\recon | Out-Null; $log='C:\ProgramData\recon\recon.log'; try { $key=$env:HIBP_API_KEY; if([string]::IsNullOrWhiteSpace($key)){ throw 'HIBP_API_KEY not set'; } $headers=@{ 'hibp-api-key'=$key; 'Accept'='application/json'; 'User-Agent'='Recon-Admin/1.0' }; $uri="https://haveibeenpwned.com/api/v3/breachedaccount/$account?truncateResponse=true"; $resp=Invoke-WebRequest -Uri $uri -Headers $headers -Method Get -UseBasicParsing -TimeoutSec 45 -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue; if($resp -and ($resp.StatusCode -ge 200) -and ($resp.StatusCode -lt 300) -and ($resp.Headers['Content-Type'] -match 'application/json')){ ($resp.Content | ConvertFrom-Json) | ConvertTo-Json -Depth 6 | Set-Content -Path $out -Encoding UTF8 } elseif($resp -and $resp.StatusCode -eq 404){ Add-Content -Path $log -Value "$(Get-Date -Format o) HIBP no breach data for $account (404)." } else { Add-Content -Path $log -Value "$(Get-Date -Format o) HIBP non-success or non-JSON for $account. Status=$($resp.StatusCode)" } } catch { Add-Content -Path $log -Value "$(Get-Date -Format o) HIBP error for $account: $($_.Exception.Message)" }
explanation: Checks the paid Have I Been Pwned API (closed-source) for breach exposure of a specific corporate account and records structured results or a no-data condition.
rationale_steps: Authenticate to the closed-source HIBP API with a key and proper User-Agent.
Perform a targeted query to minimize noise.
Handle 200 and 404 outcomes cleanly; parse JSON on success.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The PowerShell command is perfectly well-formed with properly balanced quotes, braces, and parentheses, correct error handling syntax, appropriate variable declarations, and proper use of PowerShell cmdlets and methods.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command perfectly aligns with the T1597 technique by querying the paid Have I Been Pwned API (a closed source), using proper authentication with an API key, and storing the breach data results in a structured format for intelligence gathering purposes.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed, using valid PowerShell syntax for variable assignments, cmdlet calls, conditional logic, error handling, and API request headers.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command perfectly achieves the claimed intent by querying the paid Have I Been Pwned API, which is a closed-source intelligence feed, for breach exposure of a target account, directly aligning with MITRE ATT&CK T1597 for intelligence gathering.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: Well-formed PowerShell with balanced braces/quotes, valid parameters, and proper separators throughout.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: Accurately queries a paid closed-source HIBP API with an API key and stores/logs results consistent with T1597, though the 404 no-data path may not trigger due to Invoke-WebRequest using -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue.
